sen.j: 淳祐（じゅんゆう、寛平2年（890年） － 天暦7年7月2日 (旧暦)（953年8月18日）は、平安時代中期の真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Junyu (born 890, died July 2, 953 (old lunar calender) (Aug 18, 953) was a priest of the Shingon Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Junyu (born 890, died July 2, 953 (old lunar calender) (Aug 18, 953) was a priest of the Shingon Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Junyu (890 - August 18, 953) was a priest of the Shingon Sect in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: 父は菅原道真の子菅原淳茂。
sen.e: His father was SUGAWARA no Atsushige, a son of SUGAWARA no Michizane.
His father was SUGAWARA no Atsushige, a son of SUGAWARA no Michizane.

sen.j: 般若寺の観賢に師事して出家・受戒し、925年（延長 (元号)3年）に伝法灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: After studying under Kangen of Hannya-ji Temple, he became a priest, learned the religious precepts, and received the teachings of Buddhism as well as the enthronement initialtion known as kanjo in 925.

After studying under Kangen of Hannya-ji Temple, he became a priest, learned the religious precepts, and received denpo-kanjo (the consecration for the Transmission of the Dharma) in 925.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 真言宗小野流の法を継いだが、足に障害があり病弱であることを理由に醍醐寺寺主就任を辞退する。
sen.e: Although he succeeded to the teachings of the Ono school of the Shingon Sect, he declined to assume the post of the manager of Daigo-ji Temple due to his leg disorder and physical weakness.

sen.j: その後石山寺普賢院に隠棲した。
sen.e: He later secluded himself at Fugen-in of Ishiyama-dera Temple.
He later secluded himself at Fugen-in of Ishiyama-dera Temple.
He later secluded himself at Fugenin Temple of Ishiyama-dera Temple.

sen.j: 普賢院では多くの書物を著し、真言密教の事相の発展に寄与した。
sen.e: While at Fugen-in, he wrote many books, which contributed to the development of practical training of the esoteric Buddhism of the Shingon Sect.
While at Fugen-in, he wrote many books, which contributed to the development of the practical training of the esoteric Buddhism of the Shingon Sect.
While at Fugenin, he wrote many books, which contributed to the development of the practical training of the Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 延喜21年（921年）11月、師・観賢が醍醐天皇の勅命により高野山奥の院御廟を訪れたとき、共に御廟内に入り弘法大師の膝に触れたといわれる。
sen.e: In November 921, he accompanied his mentor Kangen, who received an Imperial order from the Emperor Daigo to visit the mausoleum of the retired emperor deep in Koya-san Mountain, and it is said that he touched Kobo Daishi's knee as he entered the place.

sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: その際、妙香の薫りが手に移り、一生消えることがなかった。
sen.e: With the touch, a fragrance of fine incense permeated his hand and remained permanently.
With the touch, a fragrance of fine incense permeated his hand and remained permanently.

sen.j: またそれにより、淳祐が書写した経典にも同様の薫りが移った。
sen.e: As a result, the same fragrance permeated the copies of the scriptures hand written by Junyu.
sen.cmt: 「同様の薫り」は文脈から「同じ薫り」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: As a result, the same fragrance permeated the copies of the scriptures hand written by Junyu.

sen.j: これを「薫の聖教（かおりのしょうぎょう）」という。
sen.e: This is what is called 'Kaori no Shogyo' (the fragrant scriptures).
